results.title: Global energy game
results.creator_credit: Paul Galan, Michael Joseloff and Gateway Film Productions
results.brief_description: Economic journalist Adam Smith hosts a group of six players each representing a different country as they play a simulated game of international oil and global energy. Covers the trade balance and inflation in terms of oil costs and American dependence on foreign oil.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Galan, Michael Joseloff and Gateway Film Productions

results.title: Glitterball (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An alien spaceship crashlands on earth. It’s piloted by the Glitterball, a small silver creature with amazing powers, and an appetite for human food. With the help of two small boys, Glitterball causes chaos, and a lot of laughs as it eats its way back to outer space.

results.title: Glimpses of South Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the place at which the colony at South Australia was proclaimed in 1836. Visits Adelaide, and Mount Gambier etc.

results.title: Glimpses of Eastern India
results.brief_description: An American girl visits her former student friend in Calcutta, tours the surrounding district and flies to the Himalayas for a short trip. Shows ancient ruins, village life, cottage industries, handwoven fabrics and magnificent variety of landscape, festivals, temples, a Buddhist monastery, the tea estates, seaside resorts.

results.title: Glimpses of China
results.creator_credit: Marcel Carriere, Francois Seguillon and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A far-reaching, all embracing picture of the new China that few outsiders have seen in such close detail. For the Canadian film crew the magic name of Norman Bethune, China’s hero doctor of the war years, opened many doors and ensured a smiling welcome. The result is an illuminating view of the people’s republic of Mao Zedong, whose monuments dominate public halls and squares. In Shanghai, Guangzhou, Beijing and Shenyang, in streets, factories, homes and schools, wherever the film turns it witnesses the same selfless dedication to the cause.

results.title: Glenn Miller : America's musical hero
results.creator_credit: Don McGlynn, Kirk D'Amico, Samuel Lockhart and VPI-Videfilm Productions International
results.brief_description: This video presents the man and the musician who with his wonderful sound touched the hearts of so many people around the world. Of all the leaders from the big band era, Miller is the most long lived and powerful. In the late 1930s and early 1940s, when he had literally dozens of popular hits, his public reception was as intense and frenzied as it was later for Frank Sinatra, Elvis and the Beatles. This is the first documentary produced about this musical legend. His life story is told through clips of the Miller band in their heyday, rarely seen home movie and newsreel footage, along with stories from numerous eye witnesses including fellow musicians, journalists and confidantes, as well as Henry Mancini and James Stewart who share some anecdotes about the making of the very successful motion picture “The Glen Miller Story”.

results.title: Glenn Gould: two portraits of the celebrated artist
results.creator_credit: Roman Kroitor, Wolf Koenig, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A fascinating two part documentary which follows the young and gifted musician Glenn Gould from his home town near Lake Simcoe, Canada to a recording studio in New York. Includes interviews with the artist and unique footage of him discussing composition with friend and fellow musician Franz Kraemar. Considered one of the greatest exponents of Bach, this portrait is an interesting view into the world of a sensitive creator and interpreter of music.

results.title: Glenn Gould off the record
results.creator_credit: Roman Kroitor, Wolf Koenig and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Celebrated Canadian concert pianist Glenn Gould, in the peaceful seclusion of his lakeside cottage. A view of Gould previously known only to intimates; to the collies pacing him through the woods, the fishermen resting their oars to catch the sublime echo of Bach from the distant shore, and the fellow musicians like Franz Kreemer, to whom Gould talks of composition. Edited by James Beveridge. Camera by Wolf Koenig.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roman Kroitor, Wolf Koenig and ONF | NFB

results.title: Glasses
results.creator_credit: Brian Duchscherer, Marcy Page and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Young Milo is a sensitive boy who like most other children just wants to be accepted at school. Above all, he yearns for the freedom and independence enjoyed by his comic book hero, Captain Cosmo, and resents his mother’s constant care and attention especially the plain, generic lunchbox she gives him instead of a Captain Cosmo one that all his other classmates own. What really holds Milo back is his poor eyesight: the world is fuzzy and this makes things difficult. He is rejected by the soccer team because he cannot score properly and ridiculed in class because he constantly misreads the numbers on the cards which his teacher puts before him. However, a trip to the optometrist and a pair of glasses improves things. But not totally. Though Milo can now read the numbers correctly in class, he still encounters trouble at soccer and bullying from his classmates. When things are at rock bottom however, Milo learns what is important and has his first experience of accepting life for what it is. Brian Duchscherer’s puppet animation is a joy to watch and brings to vivid life recognisable characters and important themes.
